title: Synthesis of Praseodymium Oxide Aggregates with Mesoporosity Using Surfactant CTAB
content: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) has classified porous materials based on their pore sizes, namely microporous, mesoporous, and macroporous. Mesoporous materials are those with a range of pores between 2 and 50 nm. Mesoporous materials find applications in catalysis and molecular sieves [1]. The synthesis of mesoporous materials began in 1992 with the creation of mesoporous silica by scientists at Mobil Company [2]. Praseodymium oxide with mesoporosity was prepared using a procedure similar to that described in our previous research on cerium oxide [3,4].
